front.title: Signalling Unnumbered Links in Resource ReSerVation Protocol - Traffic Engineering (RSVP-TE) in an IPv6 Network

abstract.t: Currently, RSVP-TE signalling over unnumbered links identifies routers using 32-bit Router IDs [RFC3477]. Traffic engineering extensions to IGP protocols for use in IPv6 networks use 128-bit IPv6 addresses to identify routers [OSPFv3-TE], [ISIS-TE]. This document specifies extensions for RSVP-TE signalling over unnumbered links to use 128-bit Router IDs in an IPv6 network.
